ir:
For the payable constructor function.
- the state variable price will be updated to 0x38d7ea4c68000.
- the state variable deadline will be updated to 0x5c7d1340.
- the state variable totalSupply will be updated to 3600.

For the claimOwnership function.
- For pendingowner:
  - the state variable owner will be updated to pendingowner. Afterthat, 
    - the state variable pendingowner will be updated to 0.

For the changeStartTime function, it has one argument and its type is uint256.
- For owner:
  - the state variable deadline will be updated to the first argument.

For the changeJackpot function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- For owner:
  - the state variable jackpot will be updated to the first argument.

For the changeWallet function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- For owner:
  - the state variable wallet will be updated to the first argument.

For the changeRoundTime function, it has one argument and its type is uint256.
- For owner:
  - the state variable totalSupply will be updated to the first argument.

For the transferOwnership function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- For owner:
  - the state variable pendingowner will be updated to the first argument.

For the getGain function, it has one argument and its type is uint256.
- When the first argument is smaller than ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply):
  - For the winner of the first argument, and the winner of the first argument is not 0:
    - it transfers ether valued the balances of the first argument to caller. Afterthat, 
      - the balances of the first argument will be updated to 0.
  - For owner, and the winner of the first argument is 0:
    - it transfers ether valued the balances of the first argument to caller. Afterthat, 
      - the balances of the first argument will be updated to 0.

For the payable fallback function.
- When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not smaller than price:
  - the winner of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to caller.
  - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is 0:
    - the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)).
    - the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)) will be updated to the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)).
    - it transfers ether valued 0 to jackpot.
    - it transfers ether valued 0 to wallet.
  - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not 0:
    - the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to ((((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply))-((20*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100))-((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100))-((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)).
    - the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)) will be updated to (((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)+the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply))).
    - it transfers ((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to jackpot.
    - it transfers ((20*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to wallet.

For the payable setBet function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not smaller than price:
  - the winner of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to the first argument.
  - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is 0:
    - the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)).
    - the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)) will be updated to the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)).
    - it transfers ether valued 0 to jackpot.
    - it transfers ether valued 0 to wallet.
  - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not 0:
    - the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to ((((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply))-((20*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100))-((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100))-((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)).
    - the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)) will be updated to (((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)+the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply))).
    - it transfers ((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to jackpot.
    - it transfers ((20*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to wallet.

messages.content: You are an experienced smart contract developer that excels at Solidity program languages. Please write a contract code by the following contract descriptions. Some state variables and programming specifications are provided to help you develop.

The following is the description of the contract logic: For the payable constructor function.
- the state variable price will be updated to 0x38d7ea4c68000.
- the state variable deadline will be updated to 0x5c7d1340.
- the state variable totalSupply will be updated to 3600.

For the claimOwnership function.
- For pendingowner:
  - the state variable owner will be updated to pendingowner. Afterthat, 
    - the state variable pendingowner will be updated to 0.

For the changeStartTime function, it has one argument and its type is uint256.
- For owner:
  - the state variable deadline will be updated to the first argument.

For the changeJackpot function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- For owner:
  - the state variable jackpot will be updated to the first argument.

For the changeWallet function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- For owner:
  - the state variable wallet will be updated to the first argument.

For the changeRoundTime function, it has one argument and its type is uint256.
- For owner:
  - the state variable totalSupply will be updated to the first argument.

For the transferOwnership function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- For owner:
  - the state variable pendingowner will be updated to the first argument.

For the getGain function, it has one argument and its type is uint256.
- When the first argument is smaller than ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply):
  - For the winner of the first argument, and the winner of the first argument is not 0:
    - it transfers ether valued the balances of the first argument to caller. Afterthat, 
      - the balances of the first argument will be updated to 0.
  - For owner, and the winner of the first argument is 0:
    - it transfers ether valued the balances of the first argument to caller. Afterthat, 
      - the balances of the first argument will be updated to 0.

For the payable fallback function.
- When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not smaller than price:
  - the winner of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to caller.
  - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is 0:
    - the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)).
    - the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)) will be updated to the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)).
    - it transfers ether valued 0 to jackpot.
    - it transfers ether valued 0 to wallet.
  - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not 0:
    - the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to ((((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply))-((20*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100))-((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100))-((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)).
    - the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)) will be updated to (((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)+the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply))).
    - it transfers ((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to jackpot.
    - it transfers ((20*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to wallet.

For the payable setBet function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not smaller than price:
  - the winner of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to the first argument.
  - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is 0:
    - the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)).
    - the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)) will be updated to the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)).
    - it transfers ether valued 0 to jackpot.
    - it transfers ether valued 0 to wallet.
  - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not 0:
    - the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to ((((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply))-((20*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100))-((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100))-((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)).
    - the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)) will be updated to (((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)+the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply))).
    - it transfers ((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to jackpot.
    - it transfers ((20*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to wallet.

.
 Here are some state variables with their corresponding types: public state variable `owner` is typed address,public state variable `pendingowner` is typed address,public state variable `winner` is typed mapping,public state variable `balances` is typed mapping,private state variable `price` is typed uint256,private state variable `deadline` is typed uint256,private state variable `totalSupply` is typed uint256,public state variable `wallet` is typed address,public state variable `jackpot` is typed address.
 Here are some programming specifications: - You must declare a variable before you can use it, but the same variable cannot be declared twice
- You must lock the pragma and use a stable version (e.g., pragma solidity `0.6.12`).
- For exteranal calls, you must use `.call()` instead of `.transfer()` and `.send()`.
- The target address who receives ether must be `payable address` type.
- You must make the function `payable` if `msg.value` is used in the public functions.
- From security perspectives, you must check whether an overflow or underflow is possible before an arithmetic operation (e.g., safemath operations), and you should determine whether the user's address is empty before transferring ether to the him.
- You cannot import external resources because you are a separate contract.
- You must use the following methods in new versions rather than old methods
  - For some built-in functions, 
    - `abi.encodePacked(...) returns (bytes memory)` performs packed encoding of arguments to bytes.
    - `keccak256(bytes memory) returns (bytes32)` computes the Keccak-256 hash of the input.
    - `sha256(bytes memory) returns (bytes32)` computes the SHA-256 hash of the input.
    - `ecrecover(bytes32 hash, uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s) returns (address)` recovers the address associated with the public key from elliptic curve signature or return zero on error. 
  - For some properties,
    - `block.number (uint)` returns the current block number.
    - `block.timestamp (uint)` returns the current block timestamp as seconds since unix epoch.
    - `blockhash(uint blockNumber) returns (bytes32)` returns the hash of the given block.
- `0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff` means `-1`, so `+0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff` indeed means `-1`.

prompts:
You are an experienced smart contract developer that excels at Solidity program languages. Please write a contract code by the following contract descriptions. Some state variables and programming specifications are provided to help you develop. The following is the description of the contract logic: For the payable constructor function.
- the state variable price will be updated to 0x38d7ea4c68000.

- the state variable totalSupply will be updated to 3600.

    - the state variable pendingowner will be updated to 0.

- For owner:

For the getGain function, it has one argument and its type is uint256.
- When the first argument is smaller than ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply):
  - For the winner of the first argument, and the winner of the first argument is not 0:

  - For owner, and the winner of the first argument is 0:
    - it transfers ether valued the balances of the first argument to caller. Afterthat,

For the payable fallback function.
- When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not smaller than price:
  - the winner of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to caller.
  - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is 0:
    - the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)).
    - the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)) will be updated to the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)).

    - it transfers ether valued 0 to wallet.
  - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not 0:
    - the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to ((((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply))-((20*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100))-((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100))-((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)).
    - the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)) will be updated to (((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)+the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply))).
    - it transfers ((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to jackpot.

- When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not smaller than price:
  - the winner of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to the first argument.
  - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is 0:
    - the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply) will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the balances of ((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)).

    - it transfers ether valued 0 to jackpot.
    - it transfers ether valued 0 to wallet.

    - the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply)) will be updated to (((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)+the balances of (1+((current time-deadline)/totalSupply))).
    - it transfers ((15*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to jackpot.
    - it transfers ((20*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to wallet.

  - For some built-in functions, 
    - `abi.encodePacked(...) returns (bytes memory)` performs packed encoding of arguments to bytes.
    - `keccak256(bytes memory) returns (bytes32)` computes the Keccak-256 hash of the input.
